pr_title: GEODE-7707: Tab completing '--url' on 'connect' gives two default values

timeline.message: GEODE-7707: Tab completing '--url' on 'connect' gives two default values

timeline.bodyText: This might be more of a @davebarnes97 question, but since http://<host>:<port>/geode-mgmt/v1 is used as the example in gfsh, should docs use something more similar to http://myLocatorHost.example.com:8080/geode-mgmt/v1 (remove the gemfire part)
timeline.author: moleske
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -185,7 +182,7 @@ Successfully connected to: [host=GemFireStymon, port=1099]
 **Example of connecting to a remote locator over HTTP:**
 
 ``` pre
-gfsh>connect --use-http=true --url="http://myLocatorHost.example.com:8080/gemfire/v1"
+gfsh>connect --url="http://myLocatorHost.example.com:8080/gemfire/v1"

replies.bodyText: I agree, I think the example in code and documentation should be aligned, Im going to modify it.
replies.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.message: GEODE-7707: Align examples in doc and code

timeline.bodyText: I have changed lines 196 & 199 to show how these strings really look (they are defined in CliStrings.java)
timeline.author: alb3rtobr

timeline.bodyText: Lines 178 & 179 are just host names, but as they are the only referece left to "GemFire" I changed it to "Geode"
timeline.author: alb3rtobr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -175,16 +175,16 @@ gfsh>connect
 ``` pre
 gfsh>connect
 Connecting to Locator at [host=localhost, port=10334] ..
-Connecting to Manager at [host=GemFireStymon, port=1099] ..
-Successfully connected to: [host=GemFireStymon, port=1099]
+Connecting to Manager at [host=GeodeStymon, port=1099] ..
